events.title: First Women's Rights Convention in the U.S.
events.description: The first National Women's Rights Convention was held in Syracuse, New York, marking a significant gathering advocating for women's suffrage and equality.
events.significance: This event was pivotal in the early women's rights movement in the United States, laying groundwork for future advancements in gender equality.

events.title: Battle of Verdun Ends
events.description: The Battle of Verdun, one of the longest and most brutal battles of World War I, ended after 10 months of fighting between French and German forces.
events.significance: The end of the Battle of Verdun marked a significant moment in WWI, symbolizing French resilience and resulting in enormous casualties that influenced subsequent war strategies.

events.title: The Galileo Spacecraft Arrives at Jupiter
events.description: NASA's Galileo spacecraft entered orbit around Jupiter to begin its detailed study of the planet and its moons.
events.significance: Galileo's mission provided unprecedented information about Jupiter, enhancing understanding of the planet's atmosphere, magnetosphere, and satellites.
